text: Calvin Lawrence Christensen (July 8, 1927 – August 31, 2011) was an American basketball player. He played collegiately for the University of Toledo. He was selected by the Tri-Cities Blackhawks in the 5th round of the 1950 NBA draft. He played for the Blackhawks (1950–51), Milwaukee Hawks (1951–52) and Rochester Royals (1952–55) in the NBA for 291 games. He died in 2011 in Waterville, Ohio where he lived with his wife of 51 years, Sharon.Cal CHRISTENSEN Obituary - Waterville, OH | Toledo Blade Retrieved 2018-05-29. ==References== ==External links== Category:1927 births Category:2011 deaths Category:American men's basketball players Category:Basketball players from Ohio Category:Centers (basketball) Category:Milwaukee Hawks players Category:People from Waterville, Ohio Category:Power forwards (basketball) Category:Rochester Royals players Category:Sportspeople from Toledo, Ohio Category:Toledo Rockets men's basketball players Category:Tri-Cities Blackhawks draft picks Category:Tri-Cities Blackhawks players Category:Washington Generals players
title: Cal Christensen
